nodes.text:
{COMMANDER.FirstName}. Darius. Sumire. Yang. Farah. Through your courage, skill, and sacrifice, the Reach has been saved and I have reclaimed my throne. Without any one of you, our campaign would have ended in tragedy.

I can never adequately repay you for your service to the Reach.
nodes.comment: Fade In, GC_602_EPILOGUE, Set Viewscreen: kamea2

nodes.text:
I owe you a great debt as well. Without your company's help, I would be dead.

I consider it a great honor to call you my friends.

branches.responseText: The feeling is mutual, Lord Madeira. We'll miss having you aboard the Argo.
If you ever get tired of politics, you're always welcome on our crew.
Friendship never entered the equation, Lord Madeira. Our client gave us a job to do, and we delivered.

nodes.text:
That means a great deal to me, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.

Thank you.

A compelling offer, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.

I'll keep it in mind.

I respect your honesty, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.

A mercenary to the end.

It's a new era for the Reach, and I have your company to thank for it.

The Directorate has fallen, Victoria is dead, and my uncle is in chains.

branches.responseText: You'll give him a show trial, I imagine. I'd appreciate an invitation.
You should have let me kill him.
You took Espinosa alive. What're you gonna do with him?

nodes.text:
There will be no trial… at least, not in the Reach. Alexander gave me a better alternative.

Don't worry, though. My uncle will receive his taste of justice soon enough.

The thought had crossed my mind, but Lord Madeira convinced me otherwise. With the Reach in as fragile a state as it is, we can't risk making a martyr of him.

Don't worry, though. He'll receive his taste of justice soon enough.

Initially, I was going to try him myself, but Alexander convinced me otherwise… there are risks inherent in holding such a man for any length of time, and the Reach is in a fragile enough state as it is.

Don't worry, though. He'll receive his taste of justice soon enough.

branches.responseText: Consider my curiosity piqued. What did you do with him?
There is no justice terrible enough for that man.

nodes.text:
We've handed him over to [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreThomasCalderon],Protector Thomas Calderon]], to be tried as the mastermind of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LorePerditionMassacre],Perdition Massacre]]. His war crimes tribunal is being assembled as we speak.

The Taurians were quite appreciative of the gesture.

That's probably true, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}… but I trust [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreThomasCalderon],Protector Calderon]] to give it his all. Director Santiago Espinosa will be tried in a Taurian court as the mastermind of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LorePerditionMassacre],Perdition Massacre]]. His war crimes tribunal is being assembled as we speak.

The Taurians were quite appreciative of the gesture.
I'm sure they were… and that's the last we'll hear of Director Espinosa.

He brought his fate upon himself.

I'm afraid that our time is growing short, {COMMANDER.Callsign}—we have a great deal of work to do if we're going to recover from this war. But if you have any final questions before we move on to the subject of your pay, I'll be happy to hear them.

branches.responseText: Before we talk money, I'd like to hear what's next for the Restoration.
The subject of our pay, huh? As it happens, I can think of nothing I'd rather talk about.

nodes.text:
I was wondering the same thing. I mean, you've retaken your throne, and that's wonderful, but the Reach is in ruins.

How are you planning to rebuild?

Slowly, and with great caution. We can't afford to spread ourselves too thin… but neither can we leave our more marginal systems hanging.

In the short term, we're going to need to secure funding and support from sources outside the Reach. The economy of the old Aurigan Coalition is all but destroyed, and our infrastructure is in extremely poor shape.

branches.responseText: How do you intend to go about getting that support?
Finding what you're looking for is gonna be difficult. You don't have a lot to offer in return.

nodes.text:
However we can. Political marriages will be invaluable… our sovereignty is our greatest asset, and I'm still thinking through ways to capitalize on it.

We'll have difficult times ahead, to be sure. But we will weather them, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. The Reach is nothing if not resilient.

branches.responseText: Perhaps the Taurians. Your uncle wasn't wrong that they'd be worthy allies.
Kamea's hand included?

nodes.text:
And now, {COMMANDER.Callsign}, we should move on to discuss your company's compensation. You've certainly earned it.

For your exemplary work both on and off of the battlefield, you will be paid handsomely. Those were the terms of our arrangement… but you deserve a little more than that, I think.

That's true, but we'll do our best with what we have. Political marriages will be invaluable… our sovereignty is our greatest asset, and I'm still thinking through ways to capitalize on it.

Difficult times are ahead, to be sure. But we will weather them, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. The Reach is nothing if not resilient.

Very good, {COMMANDER.Callsign}… you've certainly earned it. For your exemplary work both on and off of the battlefield, you will be paid handsomely.

Those were the terms of our arrangement. But you deserve a little more more than that, I think.
A second token of my appreciation is on its way to your Mech Bay now, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. Please accept it with my compliments.

branches.responseText: I don't often get overpaid by my clients. I could get used to it.
Thank you, Kamea. We'll put your gifts to good use.

nodes.text:
I'm sure you could.

And with that, {COMMANDER.Callsign}, I'm afraid that I must return to matters of state. My people need me, and I must get back to helping where I can. You will always be remembered as friends of the Reach—every one of you.

Good. And with that, {COMMANDER.Callsign}, I'm afraid that I must return to matters of state. My people need me, and I must get back to helping where I can.

You will always be remembered as friends of the Reach—every one of you.

branches.responseText: Goodbye, Kamea. Rule wisely and well. Make Raju Montgomery proud.
We'll see you again someday, I'm sure.
If you need anything, call us. I'll be there.

nodes.text:
I'll try, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. Believe me… I'll try.

Farewell, my friends. I wish you success in your adventures to come.

I'd like that. Until then, I'll bid you a very fond farewell.

Be well, {COMMANDER.Callsign}. I wish you success in your adventures to come.
[The image on the viewscreen flickers and dies. Lady Arano is gone.]

I guess that's it. Our contract with Lady Arano is over, the Restoration is complete, and we're free to do whatever we please.

Man, it feels weird saying that. We can do whatever we want—we're not beholden to anybody.

It's a pretty sweet feeling, I've gotta say.

So… who else wants to go find some new trouble to get into? Peacetime is beautiful and all, but it's starting to feel a little stale in here.
I'm game if you are. Trouble is our business, after all. And we've got more than enough BattleMechs to handle whatever fate throws our way.

branches.responseText: I don't know about the rest of you, but I'm in the mood to earn a few C-Bills.
"Whatever fate throws our way," huh? Sounds like a challenge to me.

nodes.text:
Roger that, {COMMANDER.FirstName}. You all heard the Commander—take your stations, and make it quick.

We've got an open sky ahead of us, and there's money to be made.

Roger that, {COMMANDER.FirstName}—I'll pull up a fresh batch of contracts.

Take your stations, everybody. Let's go find ourselves a new adventure.
Of course, {COMMANDER.FirstName}. Who I marry will have a tremendous impact on the future of the Aurgian Reach. You know I can't allow personal feelings into it.

I will, {COMMANDER.FirstName}. Until then, I'll bid you a very fond farewell.

Be well. I wish you success in your adventures to come.
